subject: p11378150
History: Hypoxia during left transbronchial biopsy. Please evaluate for pneumothorax.
Findings: Single portable chest radiograph demonstrates a large rounded opacity in the left lower lung, correlating with known left lung mass, better visualized on the PET-CT. No focal opacification concerning for pneumonia. Bibasilar atelectasis is evident. Coarse linear interstitial markings in left upper lobe may reflect emphysematous change. There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Prominent pericardial fat pads are evident otherwise, cardiomediastinal contours are normal.
Impression: No pneumothorax. Large left lower lobe mass, better evaluated on prior CT.
